</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns if the player is currently playing in cadet or veteran mode. <br><br> <template><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> In Arma 3 this command returns status for global [[Arma_3_Difficulty_Menu | difficulty]] <tt>showCadetHints</tt></value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''cadetMode''' </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] - true when playing in cadet mode, false when playing in veteran mode </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>? ([[cadetMode]]) : _AIsoldier [[setSkill]] 0.1 //sqs</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] ([[cadetMode]]) [[then]] {_AIsoldier [[setSkill]] 0.1}; //sqf</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[hintCadet]], [[difficulty]]</value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on December 1, 2009 - 17:49
<dt class="note">[[User:Killswitch|Killswitch]]<dd class="note">
In ArmA II, this command will return true if the difficulty level is set to "Recruit" or "Regular". It returns false for the "Veteran" and "Expert" difficulty levels.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
